text: When the Sirens saw Ulysses' ship passing by and noticed that those men had their ears covered so as not to hear them sing (to them, the most beautiful and seductive women!) They smiled contemptuously and said, "What kind of men are these who willingly resist the Sirens? So they kept quiet, and let them go in the midst of a silence that was the worst of insults. Fin 1966
title: Silencio de sirenas
author: Marco Denevi
